rComments: She gives tons of readings. The course was about Bourdieu, yet Bourdieu wrote none of the course readings. She constantly references her research decades ago, however, complaining about student's reference not recent enough. The class was very dry, she asked one question and waited until someone can answer.

Bonnie Erickson is a great lecturer who makes course content relatable to everyday life. She provided a lot of opportunity for class discussion which allowed students to engage with one another. I felt as if the essay for this class (worth 40%) was graded toughly, but the exams were fair as she provided a question bank.

She has been by far the worst prof I've had at U of T. Lectures were very dry. Things that were common sense, she made unnecessarily hard. She was such a difficult marker. Her feedback on essays was something like "your sources were outdated," when she herself would give us sources to use that dated back to 1996. I did not enjoy this course at all.

Sends long word documents before class and then just talks without slides, so it's very dry and hard to just follow. She's a reeally tough marker too. She also complains if you use sources that are around 2012 because they "aren't recent enough", yet constantly references her own studies from 1996
She is a very good teacher and made my SOC course enjoyable. The exams were all about applying the readings, which were on topic and interesting. Would take her course again!
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback', 'Tough grader']

rComments: As long as you do your readings, you'll fine. She gives you the terms and materials that are expected on the exam. Possible for A.

hard to prepare for tests. though she provides questions bank, she offers too many questions-15 essay questions and 15 short answer for the final question bank. but she and TA are not tough graders so earning a decent grade is fairly easy. lectures are not bad if you are interested in the topics and i do feel that course materials are useful.

Horrible, just horrible. Her lectures are boring, her material is hard to understand and she likes to ramble on about personal stuff. In addition, she uses old material from like when she was a student which was probably over 50 years ago. Its a new generation, adapt to your demographic. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!

Decent lecturer but tests are unnecessarily difficult (gives you 15 short answer and 15 essay questions to prepare for tests). Grading was inaccurate/unfair in my opinion. Too much emphasis on using resources that she likes - basically, if she doesn't like your reference you will lose lots of marks. Unclear comments on tests and essays as well.

My favourite prof at UofT ... can be quite entertaining with her witty comments and is always willing to help. The material can be a bit dry (especially the required readings) but if you do the work, it's not hard to get a good mark. Erickson is one of the best!

The good part is that the notes are posted online (aka: don't bother showing up) and the current TA, Cote, is extremely competent. On the other hand, the term paper is pretty challenging, and very time consuming. I can't figure out if this is a bird's course or not, but it's pretty easy, despite being relatively boring.

My favorite prof! Welcomes class discussions and is very nice! You don't need to take notes in class, just go and listen and understand instead of trying to scribble down every single word. She also gives you the exam ahead of time (although its the type where she gives you like ten essays and only one appears on the exam...).

Ok well we could whine about the fact that she repeats what it says on her overheads, or we could enjoy the fact that she puts them online making it relatively easy to get a good grade without attending class. do the reading and youre good to go.

This  class was not very interesting and the way she presented material (overhead) made it diffacult to take notes. She apparently welcomed class discussions, yet any student who opposed her opinions was simply told they were wrong. She was also not teribbly approachable.

What an awful prof, she seems cold and snobby and is condescending to the students who bother to raise their hands up during discussions that nobody in the class wants. The last half hour of class is like pulling teeth! Echoing the previous post, B.E. also lectures by reading off an overhead in her 300-level class and makes the subject SO boring.
Erickson is very inconsiderate and mean. Her lectures are pretty boring. She basically gives a summary of the readings. The material is interesting, though.
